trans-unit.source: Represents the `<saml:Action>` element within a SAML assertion that contains an action on a specified resource.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction> class corresponds the `<saml:Action>` XML element which is defined in the OASIS SAML v1.1 specification.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction> class when specifying a claim about the ability of a subject <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> to perform a specified action on a specified resource.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction> class to specify the desired action and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision> class to specify the access decision.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action%2A> property represents that action and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Namespace%2A> property specifies the XML namespace in which the action is defined.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction> position in the SAML object hierarchy is:
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction"></xref> class.

When using this constructor, to specify the desired namespace for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction> statement set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Namespace%2A> property.
To specify the desired action, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction"></xref> class using the specified action.
The `action` parameter sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action%2A> property.
The action that the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> security token seeks to perform on the specified resource.
action is `null`.
-or-
action is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction"></xref> class using the specified action.
The `action` parameter sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action%2A> property.
The `ns` parameter sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Namespace%2A> property.
The action that the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> security token seeks to perform on the specified resource.
The XML namespace in which the action parameter is defined.
action is `null`.
-or-
action is .
Gets or sets the action that the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> can perform on the specified resource.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action%2A> property corresponds to the text of the `<saml:Action>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
Gets or sets the action that the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token seeks to perform on the specified resource.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action"></xref> property is set to `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action"></xref> property is set.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.IsReadOnly%2A> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true`.
Gets or sets the XML namespace in which the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action"></xref> property is defined.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Namespace%2A> property corresponds to the `Namespace` attribute of the `<saml:Action>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The XML namespace in which the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Action"></xref> property is defined.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction.Namespace"></xref> property is set.
Reads the `<saml:Action>` element using the specified XML reader.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the `<saml:Action>` XML element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML assertion that are defined in the SAML specification.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature for SAML assertions referenced by the `<saml:Advice>` XML element.
reader is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
Writes the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAction"></xref> into the specified XML writer as a `<saml:Action>` element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the `<saml:Action>` element.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing the `<saml:Action>` element and its child elements and attributes that are defined in the SAML specification.
writer is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
